content: Only show raw string assist when there is some benefit. For example, it should show for "Hello \" world" but not for "Hello world"
tbh, I think it is a feature
The way I type raw strings is pressing ", then alt+Enter, then Enter. That way, I don't need to type r## which is the most annoying part
Why is raw string assist feels annoying to you? Does it conflict with some higher priority assist?
yellow bulb in vscode shows at every single string

In the limit, the lightbulb will be available everywhere, it's just we have too few assist right now :-)

You can disable the bulb visual via "editor.lightbulb.enabled": false

thanks
also, is there any way to disable to some assists?
No, we only have opt-out of diagnostics I think
Though we should add one for asssits as well.
